summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney to someone named Andrew regarding two FedEx records (PDFs) that contain references to a female recipient. The sender suggests these records may need authentication by a custodian and offers them to start that process.

persons.name: Andrew
persons.context: Addressed in an email from an Assistant United States Attorney regarding FedEx records that may require authentication.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, works at the United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, and is providing FedEx records related to a case.

connections.description: Colleagues or legal professionals communicating about case-related FedEx records that may require authentication.

events.title: Email regarding FedEx records
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails Andrew about two FedEx records (PDFs) that reference a female recipient, suggesting they may need authentication by a custodian.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email dated July 19, 2021, from an Assistant United States Attorney to Andrew.
It references two FedEx records (PDFs) that contain information about a package sent to a female recipient.
The sender suggests these records may require authentication by a custodian for legal purposes.
The email indicates ongoing legal proceedings or investigations involving documentary evidence like FedEx records.
